text: Vusamazulu Credo Mutwa (21 July 1921 â€“ 25 March 2020) was a South African Zulu sangoma (traditional healer). He is known for writing books about African mythology, traditional Zulu folklore and extraterrestrial encounters. His works include Indaba my Children and Tree of Life Trilogy. He was born in the Colony of Natal (present day KwaZulu-Natal). Mutwa believed in using traditional African medicines for the treatment of HIV/AIDS, cancer and tuberculosis. He also agreed with David Icke's "reptilian" theory. Mutwa died on 25 March 2020 at the age of 98. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2020 deaths Category:South African writers
